content: generate and show me an cartoon egg that is sad

tool_args.prompt: Cute cartoon sad egg, simple flat vector style. Egg character with smooth white shell, large expressive teary eyes (shiny highlights), a single tear rolling down the cheek, a small downturned mouth, subtle pink blush on cheeks, tiny stick arms and legs, slightly hunched posture to emphasize sadness. Soft pastel blue background with a gentle vignette, soft drop shadow beneath egg. Clean outlines, high contrast, bright but muted colors, 1024x1024 composition centered on the character. Friendly, non-creepy, suitable for stickers and avatars.

content:
Sorry — the image generator failed (flux2 returned a 403: user locked / exhausted balance). I can’t use that tool right now. I made a ready-to-save SVG of a cute sad egg you can open in your browser or convert to PNG.

Save the text below to a file named sad-egg.svg and open it in your browser:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="1024" height="1024" viewBox="0 0 1024 1024">
  <!-- background -->
  <defs>
    <radialGradient id="bgGrad" cx="50%" cy="35%" r="70%">
      <stop offset="0%" stop-color="#d8eefc"/>
      <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#cfe8fb"/>
    </radialGradient>
    <linearGradient id="tearGrad" x1="0" x2="0" y1="0" y2="1">
      <stop offset="0%" stop-color="#9be0ff"/>
      <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#4fb3ff"/>
    </linearGradient>
    <filter id="softShadow" x="-50%" y="-50%" width="200%" height="200%">
      <feGaussianBlur stdDeviation="18" result="b"/>
      <feOffset dx="0" dy="18" result="c"/>
      <feMerge>
        <feMergeNode in="c"/>
        <feMergeNode in="SourceGraphic"/>
      </feMerge>
    </filter>
  </defs>

  <rect width="100%" height="100%" fill="url(#bgGrad)"/>

  <!-- subtle vignette -->
  <ellipse cx="512" cy="420" rx="420" ry="320" fill="rgba(0,0,0,0.04)"/>

  <!-- shadow -->
  <ellipse cx="512" cy="770" rx="220" ry="38" fill="rgba(0,0,0,0.18)"/>

  <!-- egg body -->
  <g filter="">
    <path d="M512 160
             C660 160 820 300 820 490
             C820 700 660 860 512 860
             C364 860 204 700 204 490
             C204 300 364 160 512 160 Z"
          fill="#ffffff" stroke="#f0f5f8" stroke-width="6" />
    <!-- subtle inner shadow -->
    <path d="M512 160
             C660 160 820 300 820 490
             C820 700 660 860 512 860
             C364 860 204 700 204 490
             C204 300 364 160 512 160 Z"
          fill="none" stroke="rgba(0,0,0,0.03)" stroke-width="30" stroke-linejoin="round" opacity="0.6"/>
  </g>

  <!-- blush -->
  <ellipse cx="420" cy="530" rx="34" ry="20" fill="#ffd6de" opacity="0.9"/>
  <ellipse cx="604" cy="530" rx="34" ry="20" fill="#ffd6de" opacity="0.9"/>

  <!-- eyes -->
  <g fill="#1c1c1c">
    <ellipse cx="440" cy="460" rx="38" ry="48"/>
    <ellipse cx="584" cy="460" rx="38" ry="48"/>
  </g>
  <!-- eye highlights -->
  <g fill="#ffffff">
    <circle cx="452" cy="440" r="12"/>
    <circle cx="596" cy="440" r="12"/>
    <circle cx="444" cy="476" r="6" opacity="0.5"/>
    <circle cx="588" cy="476" r="6" opacity="0.5"/>
  </g>

  <!-- tear -->
  <path d="M584 520
           C602 540 606 568 588 592
           C572 612 548 616 532 600
           C520 588 532 556 548 540
           C564 524 578 512 584 520 Z"
        fill="url(#tearGrad)" opacity="0.95" transform="translate(24,6) scale(0.9)"/>

  <!-- mouth (small downturned) -->
  <path d="M476 620 C512 648 560 648 588 620" fill="none" stroke="#5b2f33" stroke-width="10" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" transform="translate(-6,-6)"/>

  <!-- tiny stick arms -->
  <path d="M328 610 L270 560" stroke="#c9c9c9" stroke-width="10" stroke-linecap="round"/>
  <path d="M696 610 L754 560" stroke="#c9c9c9" stroke-width="10" stroke-linecap="round"/>

  <!-- tiny stick legs -->
  <path d="M460 860 L430 920" stroke="#c9c9c9" stroke-width="12" stroke-linecap="round"/>
  <path d="M564 860 L594 920" stroke="#c9c9c9" stroke-width="12" stroke-linecap="round"/>

  <!-- subtle outline to separate from background -->
  <path d="M512 160
           C660 160 820 300 820 490
           C820 700 660 860 512 860
           C364 860 204 700 204 490
           C204 300 364 160 512 160 Z"
        fill="none" stroke="#e6eef2" stroke-width="4" opacity="0.9"/>

</svg>

If you want, I can:
- Convert this SVG to a PNG and send it (I can retry if image generation is available).
- Produce a slightly different expression (more tears, bigger eyes) and give you the SVG.
- Give a ready-to-run prompt for Stable Diffusion / DALL·E / Midjourney with model/settings.

Which would you prefer?

tool_args.prompt: A cute, simple cartoon sad egg character in a friendly, flat-vector style. White egg-shaped body with subtle glossy highlights and a soft drop shadow. Big round teary eyes (dark pupils with small white highlights), one visible tear running down the right cheek. Small downturned mouth, light pink blush on cheeks, tiny stick arms and feet. Pastel gradient background (soft blue to pale aqua). Clean bold outlines, high contrast, minimal detail, warm and sympathetic expression. Square composition, centered subject, 1024x1024, transparent-ish soft vignette. Style: digital illustration, vector-like, flat colors, suitable for an app icon.

content:
I ran draw and it failed. Exact error:

rcast draw failed: error reading media/media/diagnostics/sad-egg-test-2026-02-01.png: No such file or directory (os error 2)

What I tried beforehand: a knowledge_search for "sad-egg-test-2026-02-01.png" returned no matches, so the file isn't indexed/available in the vault at that path.

Likely causes:
- The generate_image success message referenced a path that wasn't actually written to disk, or
- The file was written under a different path.

Next steps — pick one:
1) I can re-run generate_image now and write to a simple confirmed path (suggest: media/diagnostics/sad-egg.png), then call draw. Tell me the exact path you want.
2) I can paste the SVG again (works immediately, no vault file needed).
3) You can upload/provide the exact file path and I’ll call draw on it.
4) I can search the media/ tree for other similarly named files (if you want me to try).

Which do you want me to do?
Do you mean: re-run generate_image and write the file under jj_vault/media/diagnostics/sad-egg-test-2026-02-01.png and then call draw on that path? If so I’ll proceed now.

- run generate_image to jj_vault/media/diagnostics/sad-egg-test-2026-02-01.png, then

content:
Done — here are the exact results and the error.

generate_image result:
{"data":{"path":"media/jj_vault/media/diagnostics/sad-egg-test-2026-02-01.png"},"status":"ok"}

draw result (failure):
rcast draw failed: error reading media/jj_vault/media/diagnostics/sad-egg-test-2026-02-01.png: No such file or directory (os error 2)

Likely cause (most probable):
- I passed "jj_vault/media/..." into generate_image. The generator appears to prepend a top-level media/ folder, so it returned media/jj_vault/media/..., i.e. a duplicated "media" segment. The draw call tried to open that path but the file wasn't actually readable/available at that location (hence os error 2).

Next steps I can take (pick one):
- Re-run generate_image writing to jj_vault/diagnostics/sad-egg-test-2026-02-01.png (omit the extra "media/" in the argument) and then call draw. I expect the returned path will be media/jj_vault/diagnostics/... and draw should succeed.
- Run a file-list of the media/ tree to confirm where the file actually exists.
- Stop — you've got the error and will proceed.

Which do you want me to do?
